item.title: Subqueries in MySQL - Simple Talk
item.description: A subquery is a type of query that is embedded—or nested—into a data manipulation language (DML) statement. The data returned by the subquery is passed into the DML statement and incorporated into its overall logic. The subquery itself is typically a SELECT statement, although you can also use a TABLE statement or VALUES statement. Even so, the SELECT statement continues to be the most common choice for subqueries, and that’s the one I focus on in this article.
item.author: (Robert Sheldon)

item.title: Our journey to F#: C#-F# Interop – planetgeek.ch
item.description: When we started with TimeRocket in 2015, we used C# as the programming language for our backend. In 2020, we started using F# for our new code. We see little value in rewriting existing C# code to F# and do so only when major changes are due in existing C# code. As a result, we have quite a bit of C#-F# interop in our system. Both from C# to F# and from F# to C#. This post overviews what we learned about C#-F# interop.
item.author:
(Urs Enzler
View all posts)

item.description: In the previous post I showed how to pass a Polly Policy Wrap into an Minimal API endpoint with dependency injection. In this post I'll show to use the Policy Wrap with the Http Client Factory, passing that into the endpoint.

item.title: Domain-Driven Microservices with F#
item.description: It is well-known, or at least well-documented, that F# is an excellent language for doing type-driven development using domain driven design, although it may be less well known that F# is an excellent language for microservices. Indeed, microservices benefit greatly from F#'s typesystem - making it easy to focus

item.title: Plotting Sweden's real estate prices on a heatmap with deck.gl and Cloudflare
item.description: A heat map of apartment prices in central Stockholm Disclaimer: I will be linking to sites in Swedish. A translation extension might be handy! I, like a lot of people in Stockholm, need to buy an apartment. The rental situation is bad. Getting a &ldquo;first-hand contract&rdquo; is hard. I have friends who have even had to settle for temporary &ldquo;third-hand&rdquo; contracts! With finding a rental unit out of the picture, buying is the only option.
item.author: (:: Alexander Dahl)

item.title: Spicing Up Your Conversations: The Power of Salt, Acid, Fat, and Heat | David Bieber
item.description: Good conversation is an essential part of human interaction. It allows us to connect with others, share our thoughts and ideas, and learn from one another. But in a world where we are constantly bombarded with information and distractions, it can be difficult to hold someone’s attention and have a truly engaging conversation. One way to improve the quality of our conversations is by using the elements of “salt, acid, fat, and heat”.
